subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Self-Awareness: The Foundation of Leadership
description: A micro-lesson that makes Self-Awareness: The Foundation of Leadership usable.

hook.text: Ray Dalio built Bridgewater into the world's largest hedge fund by obsessing over his own weaknesses.

buildup.text: Self-awareness is accurately understanding your emotions, strengths, weaknesses, and impact on others.

discovery.text: Research by Tasha Eurich found only 10-15% of people are truly self-awareâ€”even those who think they are.

twist.text: Experience doesn't help. Eurich found senior leaders are actually less self-aware than junior employees.

climax.text: Dalio created 'radical transparency' where anyone at Bridgewater could critique the CEO publicly.

punchline.text: You can't lead others until you understand yourself.

quiz.question: What did Tasha Eurich's research reveal about self-awareness?
options: Only 10-15% of people are truly self-aware, even among leaders
Most executives develop self-awareness through experience
Self-awareness is primarily determined by personality type
